ref: Jour: Physical Review Letters, Vol.81, p.3100 (1998)
title: Beta decay of Ni-68-74 and level structure of neutron- rich Cu isotopes.

x4freetext: Beta decay of Ni-68-74 and level structure of neutron-
rich Cu isotopes.

x4codes.hlp: Catholic Univ. of Louvain, Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium

x4codes.hlp: University of Maryland, College Park, MD, United States of America

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Physical Review Letters, Vol.81, p.3100 (1998)

x4freetext: Two U-238 targets of 15 mg/cm**2, were used.
/By compiler/ All decay-data have been determined by
authors.
.Two high-efficiency germanium detectors were
placed around the source. More detail information for
used detector is absent.
Thin plastic detector was used for detecting the
beta-particles.

x4codes.hlp: Catholic Univ. of Louvain, Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium

x4freetext: At the Leuven Isotope Separator on-line
with an ion-guide laser ion source.

x4codes.hlp: On-line mass separation of a product

x4freetext: Two U-238 targets were installed in a gas cell
filled with the 500 mbar of argon. The reaction recoil
products were thermalized and neutralized in the buffer
gas. The gas flow transported  the atoms into the beam
paths of two excimer-pumped dye lasers, that
selectively ionized the nickel atoms in the two-step
process. At the exit hole of the gas cell, the ions
were injected into sextupole ion guide, connecting the
high pressure area of gas cell to the low pressure zone
of the mass-separator.
Beta detector gated gamma spectrum.
.By CAJAD.
.The uncertainty is reported by authors. Any
analysis is absent.
Last checking has been done.
SD: Entry deleted. Cross section is
not measured.
